intro: Epipactis latifolia var. thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's broad-leaved helleborine, is a perennial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with prominent lips. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a complex root system and relies on mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake. Its flowering period usually occurs in late spring to early summer.
